data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current settings for subscription tracking.**

Subscription tracking adds links to the bottom of your emails that allows your recipients to subscribe to, or unsubscribe from, your emails.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current subscription tracking settings for your account. Subscription tracking enables unsubscribe and subscription management links in your emails, allowing recipients to manage their subscription preferences. Returns the SubscriptionTrackingSettings object containing the current configuration status and any associated parameters.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic and doesn't clarify what 'retrieve' means in context. Description lacks clarity about what is returned and doesn't explain the practical effect of these settings. Added specificity about return value (SubscriptionTrackingSettings object), clarified the feature's purpose, and improved actionability for AI agents to understand when to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current settings for subscription tracking.**

Subscription tracking adds links to the bottom of your emails that allows your recipients to subscribe to, or unsubscribe from, your emails.
data.description_suggestion: Updates the subscription tracking settings for your account. Allows you to enable or disable subscription tracking, which adds subscription management links to the bottom of your emails. Accepts a SubscriptionTrackingSettings object with the desired configuration. Partial updates are supported - only provided fields will be modified. Returns the updated SubscriptionTrackingSettings object. Changes take effect immediately for new messages.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't indicate what action is being performed. This significantly improves AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to enable or disable your current click tracking setting.**

Click Tracking overrides all the links and URLs in your emails and points them to either SendGrid's servers or the domain with which you branded your link. When a customer clicks a link, SendGrid tracks those [clicks](https://sendgrid.com/docs/glossary/clicks/).

Click tracking helps you understand how users are engaging with your communications. SendGrid can track up to 1000 links per email
data.description_suggestion: Enables or disables click tracking for your account. Accepts a request body with an 'enabled' boolean field to control click tracking status. When enabled, SendGrid tracks all link clicks in your emails by overriding URLs to point to SendGrid's servers or your branded domain. Returns the updated click tracking setting object. Changes take effect immediately for new messages.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks critical input details (what fields are required in request body), output details (what is returned), and side effects (when changes take effect). Added specificity about the 'enabled' field, return value, and timing of changes for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current setting for Google Analytics.**


Google Analytics helps you understand how users got to your site and what they're doing there. For more information about using Google Analytics, please refer to [Google's URL Builder](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/1033867?hl=en) and their article on ["Best Practices for Campaign Building"](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/1037445).

We default the settings to Google's recommendations. For more information, see [Google Analytics Demystified](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/google-analytics/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves your current Google Analytics tracking configuration. Returns a GoogleAnalyticsSettings object containing your tracking ID, campaign source, medium, term, and content parameters used to tag emails for Google Analytics. If not configured, returns default values based on Google's recommendations. Use this to verify your Google Analytics integration settings before sending tracked campaigns.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear, but description is vague about what specific settings are returned. Added details about the GoogleAnalyticsSettings schema properties (tracking ID, campaign parameters) and clarified the return value structure. This helps AI agents understand what data they'll receive and when to use this operation.

Google Analytics helps you understand how users got to your site and what they're doing there. Changes apply to all new emails sent after the update.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current settings for open tracking.**

Open Tracking adds an invisible image at the end of the email which can track email opens.

If the email recipient has images enabled on their email client, a request to SendGrid's server for the invisible image is executed and an open event is logged.

These events are logged in the Statistics portal, Email Activity interface, and are reported by the Event Webhook.
data.description_suggestion: Enables or disables open tracking for your account. Accepts a request body with an 'enabled' boolean field to control open tracking status. When enabled, SendGrid appends an invisible tracking image to emails to detect opens when recipients load images. Returns the updated open tracking setting object. Open events are logged in Statistics portal, Email Activity interface, and reported via Event Webhook. Changes take effect immediately for new messages.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks input details (what fields are required), output details (what is returned), and side effects (when changes take effect). Added specificity about the 'enabled' field, return value, event logging destinations, and timing of changes for better AI agent decision-making.
